headline: Easy Tortilla Pizza
description: This tortilla pizza topped with chicken, bell pepper, and cheese makes a quick dinner for one. Quadruple the recipe for a crowd-pleasing party snack!

video.description: Ready for homemade pizza in minutes? This recipe for Easy Tortilla Pizza is a total game changer. Prepare as a quick appetizer or snack for family and/or guests, and let everyone customize with their favorite toppings!
video.name: How to Make Easy Tortilla Pizza

name: Easy Tortilla Pizza
recipeIngredient: salt and ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
Place tortilla on a baking sheet. Brush with olive oil; sprinkle garlic powder, salt, and pepper on top.

Bake in the preheated oven until golden, 3 to 5 minutes. Remove from the oven and spread tomato sauce on top; arrange chicken breast, green bell pepper, and green onions over tomato sauce. Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese.
Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted, about 5 minutes. Sprinkle oregano over cheese. Slice pizza into wedges using a pizza cutter.

review.reviewBody: I got my tortilla cheese pizza
Fuzzy warm feelings with pizza delight. I added mushrooms and sauteed onions, great as a snack in the afternoons
Excellent budget friendly pizza night recipe!
I had some bread dipping oil (olive oil, garlic, Grated pecorino Romano and Italian spices) I used for the base... then topped with olive tampanade, roasted tomatoes, mozzarella and pepperoni

This was great. I didn‚Äôt pre bake the tortilla but my oven is pretty efficient. I just spread olive oil garlic and salt on my tortilla, then Lily spread it with tomato sauce and cheese and pepperoni plus fresh basil. Only 5 minutes in the oven. It was excellent!
I used RAO s spaghetti sauce/Mozzarella/turkey pepperoni/Ham/Green peppers ‚Äî easy and healthy! Delicious !
It‚Äôs really good and very easy to make The crust is just perfect! I would highly recommend this pizza!! üòÅüòÅüòÅüòÅüòÅüòÅüòÅüòÅüòÅüòÅüòÅüòÅ

Very good, very easy! My twins eat a lot and I didn't have enough pizza pans, so...I cooked in a pan over low heat (slightly above LOW). Placed tortilla in warm pan, spread olive oil around, and sprinkled garlic salt and Cajun seasoning/Italian seasonings over it. Sprinkled cheese; cheese then pepperoni; cheese then a lot more cheese onto different "pizzas" using alfredo sauce, Marinara sauce, both sauces at once. One pizza I added some fresh Romano/Parmigiano. I used the dinner plate sized tortillas. Sliced into 8 worked best! We all ate great with a few slices leftover for lunch -- Dad's lunch! Overall, very inexpensive, easy and tasty. My boys suggested that we don't need to order pizza anymore!

We've actually been making our own low carb version of this for years. We use low carb tortillas, and instead of heating the tortillas in the oven, we char them on our gas stove top burner for a half minute or so per side. Then we put the sauce and toppings on and finish in the oven. I checked out this recipe primarily to compare the time and temperature used. Basically the same as ours, but I like the idea of seasoning the tortilla before browning in the oven!

Great snack or small meal and completely open to playing around with toppings. When I want to switch it up and have a thick crust "pizza" I use some Naan bread instead of tortillas. Thanks for the recipe - I use it often!

I loved it! My husband likes a traditional hamburger cheese pizza and I like to try different toppings so this was perfect! His only complaint was thin crust so next time I will double the tortillas for him with cheese between as was suggested in another review! Great idea!
Just made the basic, pepperoni and/or cheese.
Great ‚Äúpizza‚Äù for my jr high schooler to make after school
I thought it was a wonderful idea and it tastes great oh, but the center of it was really soft
I made this little pizza using turkey pepperonis and it was amazing! Once the pizza was cooked i did put it under the broiler for a minute just to get the top good and done.
This was absolutely delicious. Easy and quick dinner option which was amazing.
Made it with the 10 inch instead.

I did not have tortillas, so I used Joseph's whole grain flat bread. It is larger and fed two people. It turned out great! Next time I will try the suggestion of "glueing" two of the pieces of the bread together with cheese. Baking the bread first does make it perfect. My family likes crispy crust.
Quick and easy to do with a toddler. We just used some turkey meat we had, and shredded parmesan & colby jack blend cheese, with spinach. Nice & crispy

Really good and much healthier. I took the advice of other reviewers and pricked the tortillas with a fork before baking to prevent the from bubbling. For my husband, I also used 2 tortillas with cheese in between to make a thicker crust. Will make again and again.

This was really good! It turned a lot better than I expected. I used marinara, sundried tomatoes, and cut up some mozzarella balls in seasoned oil we had. I did it on a chapti since that's what we had. Great quick fix for a pizza craving!
Much better than I thought. I used gluten free tortilla. Followed recipe but used Rao‚Äôs pizza sauce. And because I‚Äôm on weight watchers used fat free mozzarella cheese. Turned out perfect!

Yum!!! Only change we made was baking them for about 5 minutes total more than the recipe calls for so that the cheese for nice and browned, but it might just be because our tortillas are kind of thick.

Delicious! I made BBQ Chicken pizza and it was delicious! I followed the steps but used BBQ sauce instead of tomato sauce. Used green bell peppers, red bell peppers, and red onions and topped with mozzarella cheese. Second time making it and will make again. We love it!!
Before I found this is was planning to just throw on some sauce, cheese and eat it like that. But this recipe is actually amazing! Saved my lunch! XD
I think that the pizza was a little spicy for my taste, but overall was great. I used cheddar cheese instead of Mozzarella, but was still delicious. A thumbs up from me.
Made on mama lupes low carb tortillas. So yummy. Pepperoni and mushroom and jarred pizza sauce. Just used the cooking method for tortillas. Easy, Fantastic, and Keto!!! Thank you.
We topped ours with just canned tomato sauce, shredded cheese, and mini pepperoni. Yum! Fun, quick, and easy.
They turned out great!

It is yummy but the tortilla is kind of burnt you said to heat it for 2 to 3 minutes so I did and then after you said put the cheese in that heat it 2 to 3 minutes again and then it burns when I took it back out.

This was really good, but I left off the sauce as I am sensitive to tomato sauce. I heated my oven to 425 degrees because I wanted a really crispy crust. Make sure you poke some holes in the tortilla so it doesn't bubble up. This is perfect for me as I love lots of veggies on mine and my hubby only likes meat. Now I don't have to buy a whole separate pizza that I can't eat by myself.
Easy, simple and tasty!!
It's so easy and cool for me and the kids!! I used pizza blend cheese,carb blance tortillas and Turkey pepperoni.

This recipe has been a lifesaver! It's quick, easy, inexpensive and yummy, so I have no excuse to order unhealthy delivery or fast food even when I'm tired or short on time ;) My favorite to make are pepperoni & cheese, and BBQ chicken.
I used 2 tortillas gluing them together with cheese, then baking them. It makes for a slightly thicker crust that I prefer.
Seriously, so easy and soooo good. I brook mine at the end to make it a little crispier. A household favorite for us!
Awesome! These were so good!
So delish and easy!!! I added jalape√±os and black olives and used Colby and aged cheddar cheeses and no chicken. VERY YUMMY!!
Very nice for a easy lunch. Similar to flatbread. I put it under the broiler for a minute so cheese has nice color.
Very good! Use whatever toppings you want. This is the perfect way to make a tortilla pizza. Baking the crust first is key to it coming out just right.
